RT @shannonrwatts In 2015, a white supremacist was able to buy a gun and kill nine Black worshippers even though his background check never cleared. He was a prohibited purchaser, but federal law allows a gun sale to go through in three days - even if the background check hasn‚Äôt cleared.

RT @shannonrwatts The Sutherland Springs, Texas, gunman who killed 25 people in 2017 was a prohibited purchaser, but the Air Force didn‚Äôt properly relay the record of his conviction for domestic abuse to the federal background check database system.

Since 1994, background checks have blocked over 3.5 million gun sales to felons, domestic abusers, and other people who aren‚Äôt allowed to have guns under existing law.
